editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AIâ€”and learn a thing or two about yourselfâ€”in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.

Railboundâ€™s tough puzzles are brilliantly focused. Youâ€™re given only a handful of rail tiles to guide train cars to the correct destinations in the correct order, and yet even with limited options the potential solutions feel limitless. Do you lay track so Car 4 goes through a tunnel and waits at a crossing gate for Cars 2 and 3 to pass? Do you create loops to delay Car 2? Do you ignore the crossing gate altogether? Few games make success feel like itâ€™s always just within reach, even when it isnâ€™t. A helpful hint system keeps the difficulty from going completely off the rails.

A well is usually one of the last things weâ€™d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. Itâ€™s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means youâ€™re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone, and laser sights) give you all the help youâ€™ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.
With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.

editorialNotes.tagline: No! No! No! NO! No? No. No!

editorialNotes.standard: One of the App Storeâ€™s early sensations, Doodle Jump HD has only improved with age. The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.

The virtual Rube Goldberg machines that make up Perchangâ€™s gorgeous levels are so lovely to look at that you might forget what youâ€™re here to doâ€”move marbles into their proper pipes. With contraptions ranging from flippers to conveyer belts at your disposal, this inventive 3D puzzler requires an intoxicating mix of skill, smarts, and laser-sharp focus.

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

This spectacular collection by Zen Studios, the Jedi masters of virtual pinball, brings the Star Wars saga to life like youâ€™ve never seen it before. Based on the films, TV shows, and even iconic characters, each dazzlingly detailed game plays like a true labor of love. Beyond the brilliant table designs, the flawless physics faithfully recreate the mechanics of real pinball with stunning sights and sounds straight out of a galaxy far, far away.

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

editorialNotes.standard: With Free App of the Week, we highlight a great app you can enjoy at no charge this week. (In-App Purchases sold separately.) ZeptoLabâ€™s highly anticipated sequel is an absolute blast, filled with endless charm and brilliantly designed physics-based puzzles. Use all-new allies and abilities to feed the adorable Om Nom candy while navigating each stageâ€™s unique layout and collecting stars along the way. With new mechanics smartly layered onto the seriesâ€™ already famous gameplay, Cut the Rope 2 is continually challenging and engaging.

editorialNotes.tagline: A deceptively deep game of survival
editorialNotes.standard: How do you build a kingdom? By galloping around and flinging gold at people, then seeing how they help you. Thatâ€™s the great thing about this deceptively deep survival gameâ€”how amazing you feel when you figure out everything from securing laborers to mounting defenses against monsters. And finding all the secrets (like a unicorn that drops gold) will keep you busy for ages.
editorialNotes.short: Charge into this captivating struggle to survive in hostile territory.
